text_blocks.content: (Jury present) THE COURT: Good morning, members of the jury. Right on time, as always. Thank you very much. We will begin with the cross examination of Mr. Alessi. Mr. Alessi, I remind you that you are under oath. Mr. Pagliuca, you may proceed. MR. PAGLIUCA: Thank you, your Honor. JUAN PATRICIO ALESSI, CROSS-EXAMINATION BY MR. PAGLIUCA: Q. Mr. Alessi, let me start with, on direct examination, you testified that although your name is Juan, Mr. Epstein and Ms. Maxwell called you John; correct? A. Yes, sir. Q. Now, isn't it true that during that time period, everyone called you John; right? A. Yeah, basically. Yes. Q. And you preferred to be called John; right? A. Yes. Q. Okay. And, in fact, during that time when people would say to you, you're Juan, you would say, no, I'm not called Juan, I'm called John; right? A. If they call me Juan, yes, I answered to Juan. Q. And John? A. And John.
